author: Philip Khoo
title: cardanocataly.st Community Page
description: A central place for new and existing community members of Project Catalyst to find information, make connections, obtain guides.

assessments.note: It is not clear how creating a new site summarising other sources of information reduces the cognitive load in understanding the ecosystem. Would it not be better to clean up the official site?

The problem and solution statement is reasonable. The proposal has the potential to have a positive impact on Catalyst, but it is not clear that it is within the scope of the distributed decision-making challenge.

The first phase of the proposal made at Fund4, Project Catalyst Landing Page, was inserted in the "Catalyst Value Onboarding" challenge, which I see as reasonable, as there is alignment with the challenge brief of that challenge.

I can also see some relation to the distributed decision-making challenge, but it is less of a direct impact than the Value Onboarding challenge. In any case, there is no description in the proposal of how Landing Page can cause improvement in decision making.
Spot on. This is a a very good example of community members taking the initiative and actively seeking to improve the decision making and participation process for everyone.

The 'problem statement' is not well written because it does not really state a problem, but a part of the solution. It would be better to start with "The lack of a […].", it would be easier to understand at first.
The idea of this project is very good. It brings what the Catalyst Project is about – a platform made by the community to the community. It is a very good project. It brings the idea that with better education and organization you can improve the decision making (enhancing individual capacity you make the group better), however this is not clear.
However, I did miss two things: first, I think that would help newcomers, like me, if the team had put some link about the fund4 project; second, I missed with some KPI and to know exactly where you want to reach with this proposal, what do you expect to see as a result and what it would bring to the community or how it would help with the challenge stated.

The central place for current and new community members of Project Catalyst is the current IdeaScale platform. It's not the best platform but people are used to it. This proposal seems to duplicate a lot of the current IdeaScale functions and could create even more confusion by scattering resources further. I like that this platform is community driven, but unless it's to replace the IdeaScale platform completely I'm not sure if this would help new community members.
assessments.reply: This CA does not appear to understadn the nanture of Project Cataclyst and the vendor/customer nature of the relationship between PC and Ideascale

assessments.note: This proposal addresses the growing need for additional infrastructure to host the growing Catalyst Community.  The entire community would benefit from the creation of this and there are plans to be able to make fixes and changes for future issues that are brought up by the community.

I fully support this proposal, since it touches a major pain point of the CATALYST community (especially felt by a busy guy like me, who does NOT have the time for searching for scattered pieces of information). I nevertheless strongly suggest to work on the following clarifications along the road:
1) How does this relate to IdeaScale ? Will it be complementary or would it possibly replace IdeaScale in the future ?
2) How can we make sure that we integrate other (similar) proposals into this initiative.
MVP already up and running. Proposers have the ability to deliver. To be successful however this is a continually ongoing project.

The team has 3 members participating in the Catalyst community and involved in several improvement projects, such as tools for CAs, creation of documentation and they have been developing the Landing Page for several weeks, which shows their commitment. There are details about the experience / qualification and links so that the community can have more information about the proposers.

There are details on the budget allocation. The timeline described is reasonable, the proposals described would be delivered in 3 months.

The roadmap / milestones link was updated about a month ago and is unclear. There is an idea of an iterative roadmap that can be updated, but the lack of clarity makes it difficult to understand what will be delivered and when.

The community members that have initiated this proposal are already working on delivering the project. Funding will only accelerate and amplify their results. A clear background of the people involved is presented. The risk of this proposal failing is minimal.

Since the site is operational and it's not only the team participating in creating and refining the tool, the whole community can help, I think it's very feasible. Moreover, the intention of scale up and bring some professionals in design, e.g., is very rational.
The only thing that was not clear for me is the thinking that if it scales up fast, how are you intending to monetize to keep covering the costs.

There's already a MVP available which looks good and already contains a lot of the promised content, so it's likely the team would successfully implement further changes. The proposal itself is a bit confusing as it's difficult to distinguish what will be done for Fund4 and for Fund5. The proposal would benefit for making the milestones clear here rather then having to search for these in the GitHub page. The budget would benefit of bit more details e.g. will the librarian be a full time position ? What are the "management" costs specifically for ?

All members have both sound technical and SME knowledge of the Cardano ecosystem and the Catalyst system as well.  They all have relevant experience in this space and have already done work to try and build with the current system to solve some of the problems that they are looking to solve with additional funding.

The proposers are very active CATALYST community members. They are well-networked with other activists, so that this proposal has a very good chance to attract a larger number of supporters, co-designers and co-developers. The proposers have spent humble effort to provide the required background information. I consider this to be a key-project for the future if CATALYST, very likely to succeed, since it provides excellent solutions to major pain-points of today.
The project is feasible. The case for why a new source of truth on the Cardano community is required needs to be more strongly made. Would this not confuse new users more?

There is clarity in the problem and solution described, but it is not clear how the proposal will address this challenge.

There is information on the budget allocation, but I recommend more details on the allocation of resources for the bounties and the librarian, as the budget of both is relatively high and there is no clear definition of the assignments / possible workload.

The timeline for delivery of the proposal is 3 months, but the milestones defined in Github are not clear. As there are no KPIs it is difficult to audit the proposal and understand the success of the proposal.

Every required element of the proposal is present, all the details are clear without any lacks. If successfully implemented it would clearly be an asset to the Catalyst community.
My only slight concern is that there are multiple projects that seek to become the default "landing page" and resource for Project Catalyst, and this is not addressed. But even though there's bound to be some redundancy in time each could fill its own niche and attract a certain part of the community with its feature set.

The link provided with the up-to-date milestones is very intuitive and easy to visualize the progress.
However, as said before, I wish you had included some KPI and metrics to validate the evolution of the proposal and correlate this evolution with the challenge itself – like correlate the growing numbers of participants with the improvement of the decision making or with the proof of iterations, or with the overall community confidence (maybe with some surveys), etc.
assessments.reply: A nature of the community driven site means that definituive KPIs are difficult to impliment without detailed work. Proof of existance in the form of the actual site and a detailed list of issues that will be addressed by as yet unknwon participants that grows over time seems to us that it can be highly auditable.

assessments.note: There are no clear milestones or KPI's defined so it will be difficult to audit the progress and impact of this proposal. Some suggestions on metric to use as KPI could be , the increase in website visits compared to IdeaScale, number of new users contributing to the development of cardanocataly.st, bounty rewards awarded.
assessments.reply: A nature of the community driven site means that definituive KPIs are difficult to impliment without detailed work. Proof of existance in the form of the actual site and a detailed list of issues that will be addressed by as yet unknwon participants that grows over time seems to us that it can be highly auditable.

assessments.note: This proposal has a roadmap and general plan to get it moving if selected.  THis will make this proposal with the plans and features that they would like to create from the additional funding easily implementable.  Since this proposal will first build the infrastructure to build the community page and then support it there is a definition of success that is in line with DevOps.

The proposers spent the required effort to provide a breakdown of benefits, activities and costs. This will allow sufficient success-tracking and auditing along the road. More than this, I honor the entanglement of the proposers with the active CATALYST Community. This will make sure that there are not only the formal auditing steps in place, but also numerous checks & balances based on short-term feedback of 'friendly supporters'.

solution: Continue development a community driven Community Landing Page that links to the various material relating to Project Catalyst.
experience: Phil - Project lead (and front end developer), Micheal - Lead developer, Tevo - Team member of https://cardanocataly.st,
